page.title: 02Lea Green
page.content: Lea Green is in the small village of Lea near Matlock, Derbyshire and is set in 25 acres of ground.The earliest record of Lea Green goes back to a large house built in 1761. In 1895 the building was sold to {Mr.J.B. Marsden Smedley,}a local mill owner, who extended the main house. In 1960 the{Derbyshire County Council bought the house and grounds to convert it into a sports centre. Today Lea Green is usually known for its sports and local outdoor activities.There are many courses open to all age groups and up to 40 people may sleep at the centre. Next to the house is a large sports hall and tennis court. The house inside has been kept in its original state with much fine woodwork, carving and panelling. Indeed one room is entirely decorated with leather panelling.
